Dynamically generate _headers and _redirects files for Netlify in your Nuxt projects.
files for Netlify in your Nuxt.js projects.
This module supports the creation of
rules for your Netlify site: you can easily configure custom headers, basic auth, redirect instructions and rewrite rules from your
The default configuration will generate an empty
file with some caching and security headers:

# _headers

/*
  Referrer-Policy: origin
  X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
  X-Frame-Options: DENY
  X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block

/_nuxt/*
  Cache-Control: public, max-age=31536000, immutable

/sw.js
  Cache-Control: no-cache
reference automatically changes with the value of
The headers object represents a JS version of the
. You should pass in a object with string keys (representing the paths) and an array of strings for each header. For example:
You can add extra headers as follows:

# _headers

/*
  Referrer-Policy: origin
  X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
  X-Frame-Options: DENY
  X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
  Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
  X-Build: 1.0.1

/_nuxt/*
  Cache-Control: public, max-age=31536000, immutable

/sw.js
  Cache-Control: no-cache
  
/favicon.ico
  Cache-Control: public, max-age=86400
, as many as you like. You should pass in an array of objects with the redirection attributes. For example:
